author: kfogel
msg: Fix for issue #576: prevent accidentally using a versioned file as the
log message file in "svn ci -F".
Patch by: Garrett Rooney <rooneg@electricjellyfish.net>
* subversion/include/svn_error_codes.h
(SVN_ERR_CL_LOG_MESSAGE_IS_VERSIONED_FILE): New error type.
* subversion/client/cmdline/main.c (main): Check if the log message is
under version control and if so, error out unless the user has
specified --force.
* subversion/tests/client/cmdline/log_tests.py
(versioned_log_message): New test for this functionality.  Also add it
to the test_list and remove a comment that says this file doesn't work
and isn't run because it isn't in build.conf, since it does work, is
run, and is in build.conf.

author: cmpilato
msg: Renaming lock.c to repos.c

author: kfogel
msg: Patch by: Justin Erenkrantz <jerenkrantz@ebuilt.com>
* buildcheck.sh: Make libtool detection portable to Solaris /bin/sh.

author: cmpilato
msg: * subversion/libsvn_fs/dag.c
(svn_fs__dag_get_revision): Bug fix -- C-Mike forgot that skel_t's
don't have null-terminated data.  You gotsta pay attention to the
"len" field.
* subversion/tests/libsvn_fs/fs-test.c
(struct node_created_rev_args, verify_path_revs, test_node_created_rev):
New tests and helpers and stuff for testing svn_fs_node_created_rev.
(test_funcs): Added reference to new test_node_created_rev function.

author: sussman
msg: Allow the update-editor to receive special 'entry' props; these are
specially-prefixed properties that go right into a file's entry (such
as last-changed-revision, author, and date.)  This is entry
information that will be cached in the entries file for use with
keyword expansion (among other possible future uses, like 'svn
status'.)
[ 'entry props' aren't normal user properties.  Really, they're not
properties at all; they're untweakable metadata that are being
communicated via the editor's prop-mechanism.  They have the same
importance as arguments to editor calls, but are too specific to the
update-editor; therefore they're not part of the editor API, and thus
-only- the update-editor looks for them. ]
* line_endings_and_keywords.txt:  update some notes.
* svn_types.h (SVN_PROP_ENTRY_PREFIX): new property prefix ('svn:entry:')
* svn_wc.h (svn_wc_is_normal_prop): new func.  The callers of this
func (trace editors) want to know if a property was a normal,
user-visible property.  This function can now act as a single point
to filter out any update properties that are *not* normal -- such as
wcprops ('svn:wc:') or props meant for entries files ('svn:entry').
(svn_wc_is_entry_prop):  new func, to be used by the update editor,
along with its cousin svn_wc_is_wc_prop.
* props.c (svn_wc_is_normal_prop, svn_wc_is_entry_prop):  new funcs.
(svn_wc__strip_entry_prefix): new func.
* wc.h (svn_wc__strip_entry_prefix):  declare new func.
* status_editor.c (change_dir_prop, change_file_prop): use
svn_wc_is_normal_prop to filter from now on.
* trace-update.c (change_dir_prop, change_file_prop): use
svn_wc_is_normal_prop to filter from now on.
* get_editor.c (change_dir_prop, change_file_prop): use
svn_wc_is_entry_prop.
(struct file_baton): new fields entryprop_changed and entrypropchanges.
(make_file_baton): intitialize entrypropchanges array.
(close_file):  if we have entry props, append them to the log via
LOG_MODIFY_ENTRY commands.
(change_dir_prop):  if we get an entry prop, flush it to the
directory's entry.
